newsitem.title: GERMANY: UPS Germany workers plan May 22 protests.
newsitem.headline: UPS Germany workers plan May 22 protests.

text.p: United Parcel Service of America workers in Germany plan to demonstrate at locations across the country on Thursday during a worldwide day of action, union officials said.
A spokeswoman for the OeTV transport workers union told Reuters that employees of the global express company will be protesting for better conditions, more full-time posts and improved safety.
A UPS spokesman told Reuters that the company was not expecting a significant staff response to the day of action.
He added: "The service for clients will take place according to plan, not only in Germany but across Europe."
The London-based International Federation of Transport Workers (ITF) has called rallies at UPS offices in Atlanta and Brussels and at other locations in nine countries.
"Demonstrations will take place in front of UPS works. The actions will last several hours," the spokeswoman said.
"The problems are the same in Germany and around the world - part-time jobs and job safety with heavy loads," she added.
The main demonstrations would be in North Rhine Westphalia, Hesse, Baden-Wuerttemberg and Bavaria but she could not say how many of the 14,000 UPS staff in Germany would take part.
A UPS statement added that the company had gradually re-structured operations in some European countries in recent years.

"Market demands have changed and UPS has adjusted its operations to the new demands so that the long-term success of the company in Europe is also ensured in the future," the statement said. -- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom. Tel +44 171 542 7706; Fax: 5017
